revised_title: Intracellular Calcium Injection and Transmitter Release in Nerve Terminals
tldr: The author's experiments showed that injecting calcium ions into nerve terminals can cause transmitter release. This process is essential for understanding how nerve impulses transmit information between cells. The study used squid giant synapses to investigate the role of calcium ions in the release of neurotransmitters and how they affect the transmission of signals between nerve cells.
